content.description: The crux is sending the flake. Depending on the technique you use, it can be smooth as butta or rough as nails...you choose. Gear for about 10ft and then 2 bolts to the anchor. Continue past the anchor and straight up to link with Direct Service.
content.protection: Sm-lg gear and 2 bolts to the bolt anchor.
content.location: Located between RURP Ripper and Ski Tracks. The route goes up and left a giant flake to a rap anchor.

content.description: The climb takes gear 3/4 of the way up and then you'll encounter a lieback/balancing act that veers right with 2 bolts to the anchor. Note: Bring extra webbing and rap ring/quicklink just encase. The bolts for the anchor are good but there's no rap system.
content.protection: Lots of options for gear ranging from sm-med sized pro. There are 2 bolts after placing gear aside from the 2 at the anchor.
content.location: Located on the SW side of Lowenbrau. The start of the climb is at the far right of the obvious stairway of cracks. Rap from the top of the climb.

content.description: The crux is moving around the corner to the next anchor. More enjoyable if you continue up Direct Service or Face to finish at the top.
content.location: This link up starts at the anchor of Green Book.

content.description: The climb stars with fun moves using fingers and crimps while clipping two bolts. You can lead this sans bolts if you want to...smoke'em if you got'em I guess. Finishes under a boulder to the left.
content.protection: 2 bolts with sm-lg gear. Use bigger pieces for the anchor and continue up or walk over to your right to rap/continue using anchor for Green Book.
content.location: Starts 10ft to the left of Green Book.

content.description: The crux is exiting the in cut. The whole climb is sustained fingers and really fun.
content.protection: Sm-med gear. Same anchor system as Ski Tracks so bring some extra webbing and rap ring just encase.
content.location: About 10 feet to the right of Ski Tracks. It starts at an in cut and goes up to a sweet looking finger crack with lots of features.

content.description: This is the left crack of the double crack system that heads up to the hanging boulder.  Although perhaps the original line finishes in the alcove on the left side of the boulder, it is perhaps more logical to follow the right side of the boulder and finish at the anchor above Green Book.  There is a variety of opportunity for gear although one piece below the bolt and another above will suffice on this short but fun climb.  Probably a little easier than the stated grade, this is a good approach for the upper climbs.
content.protection: Small to medium gear, one bolt.  Bolted anchor

content.description: The whole climb is consistent difficulty. Finger dihedral most of the climb with cool stemming positions. Easy exit for finish with fist crack/jug.
content.protection: Sm-med sized gear. Optional large pro near the top and a bolted anchor at the finish.
content.location: About 35ft to the right of Direct North Boulder. It's easy to find because it's the cleanest dihedral that's begging for you to climb it. You can either rap from the anchor or continue right and up to link up with Direct Service or the face.

content.description: Consistent route with spacious bolt placement. You can climb from the anchor of Green Book while using the next anchor for a draw to go all the way to the top. This causes more rope drag but makes the climb last longer. If you chose the alternate way it's 5 blots to the anchor.
content.location: Begins at the same start as Direct Service. Go out right from the anchor to an exposed face climb to the top. Rap anchor at finish.

content.description: The climb gets easier as you go. It's really featured and short. Easiest way to the top and it's definitely worth it to hang out at the peak on a beautiful day in San Diego.
content.protection: Sm-med sized gear. Bolt anchor at top.
content.location: This is the 3rd pitch if you start on Green Book or RURP Ripper. It's the 2nd pitch if you start on Crackin' Up. Walk up to the apex of the rock to find a cool surprise or just rap off from the anchors to the top of Green Book.

content.description: Starts as a roof as you move up and right. Pull over the roof to ultra featured face climbing. The roof is the crux and a bit dicey if you're not a solid lead climber.
content.protection: Well placed 6 bolts to the top. Rap anchor at finish.
content.location: North side of Lowenbrau Pinnacle. Faces the lot at which you parked. Rap off top.

content.description:
I've only toproped, but it's leadable.

Awesome
content.protection: Can set up anchor after doing Green Book
content.location:
thin crack just right of Green Book.

Rap back down.

content.description:
The only info on this route is the Lowenbrau topo, which simply calls it "crack".  This is the splitter crack going up the wall on the inside of the cave, about 30 feet left of Right Under.

Scramble up a block, set one or two micro-nuts, then crank up the tips crack to a thin hands section followed by twenty feet of beautiful ring-locks.

Strangely absent from the climbing guide, this short climb is one of the best pure cracks in the county.
content.protection: Small to micro nuts to start, then three to four cams in the 0.5 range.
content.location:
Located about 30 feet left of Left Under, inside the cave.

Climb out the cave and rap down the outside face.

content.description: The start is definitely the crux with no pro for about 15ft. Links up with Ski Tracks after about 15ft.
content.protection: Med gear and 2 bolts to bolt anchor. Note: Bring extra webbing and rap ring/quicklink just encase. The bolts for the anchor are good but there's no rap system.
content.location: Route is located 5ft left of Ski Tracks. Flared seam to crack.
